Technical Product @ Uplaud. Inc

Problem: Lack of authenticated reviews, leading to opaque lead generation for SMBs. No community‑based, non‑paid/ad‑free culture for business reviews and referrals.

Visit Website
×

Technical Product @ Uplaud. Inc

The Challenge: Small and medium businesses (SMBs) struggled with opaque lead generation due to a lack of authenticated reviews. There was no community-based, ad-free platform where businesses could build genuine word-of-mouth referrals and reviews.

My Role: Technical Product Management Intern - I owned the entire product development cycle from concept to launch, focusing on creating a seamless user experience within WhatsApp's ecosystem.

The Solution: I designed and built a low-code, agentic AI system that transformed WhatsApp into a discovery and engagement platform for small businesses. The system supported three core user flows and was built with rapid iteration, metric ownership, and scalable architecture in mind. The core innovation was a closed-loop retention engine powered by LLMs, which enabled proactive, personalized nudges and intelligent re-engagement — all operating within WhatsApp’s constraints.

Core Features Delivered:

  • Business Discovery Flow: Used conversational AI prompts to guide users through personalized SMB exploration. The experience mimicked local word-of-mouth interactions with dynamic LLM-generated suggestions based on user behavior.
  • Review Submission Flow: Streamlined review collection within WhatsApp using authenticated user flows. Collected structured feedback via AI-generated summaries and metadata classification.
  • Referral Forwarding Flow: Built frictionless in-chat sharing of reviews and business profiles, generating viral growth loops with minimal user friction.
  • Analytics Dashboard: Created a centralized Airtable-based dashboard tracking DAU, WOM scores, nudge conversion rates, and review/referral growth over time. Enabled real-time insights for internal teams.

Ownership & Leadership:

  • Owned end-to-end retention and re-engagement strategy, from PRD definition through MVP launch.
  • Designed the retention engine as a standalone agentic pipeline, integrated seamlessly into the WhatsApp flow.
  • Managed internal rollout and analytics setup, ensuring the system tracked user behavior, measured effectiveness, and adapted to real-world usage patterns.
  • Defined product success metrics and drove weekly iterative improvements using user-level funnel analysis.

Technical Implementation:

  • Backend Architecture: Built comprehensive system using Airtable for data management and WhatsApp Cloud API integration.
  • Automation Pipeline: Leveraged Make.com for workflow automation and seamless API orchestration.
  • AI Integration: Incorporated both OpenAI and Gemini models for natural language processing and conversation flow.
  • Retention System: Integrated GPT-4 powered automated scheduler for timely user engagement nudges.

Results & Impact:

  • Deployed MVP to 1,000+ beta users across 3 business verticals.
  • Reduced review friction to under 2 minutes per user via AI-guided summaries.
  • Achieved organic referral loops by surfacing shareable content via agentic prompts.
  • Laid the groundwork for future monetization through lead attribution and SMB dashboards.
  • Contributed directly to strategic decisions in roadmap planning and GTM experimentation.

Technical Stack: Airtable Automation, WhatsApp Cloud API, Make.com, OpenAI GPT-4, Gemini, Node.js

InsureEase

Problem: Dual-sided confusion about insurance coverage for procedures, especially among 65+ Medicare beneficiaries. Clinics lacked a quick verification tool.

×

InsureEase

The Problem: Medicare beneficiaries and clinic staff struggled to interpret complex Evidence of Coverage (EOC) documents. This led to delays in treatment, billing errors, and patient frustration over unclear coverage.

My Role: Product Manager & AI Engineer - I led the product end-to-end — from identifying user pain points to shipping a live agentic AI system capable of parsing, comparing, and explaining Medicare coverage. I owned both product decisions and technical implementation.

Strategic Approach: To address the complexity, I scoped an MVP focused on:

  • Extracting and interpreting critical coverage information from Medicare EOC PDFs.
  • Enabling comparisons between plans and recommending optimal options based on user inputs.
  • Reducing time-to-answer for key questions like: “Is X procedure covered under Plan Y?” “What plan is best for my needs?” “Does this cover terminal illness?”
  • We validated this through real-world queries from patients and clinic staff and tracked clarity rates and session types.

Ownership & Leadership:

  • Defined Strategic Problem Space through Direct User Research:I identified the real-world challenge of insurance opacity through direct interviews with Medicare beneficiaries and clinic staff. From there, I scoped the MVP, defined product goals, and led the initiative end-to-end.
  • Cross-Functional Execution: Orchestrated cross-functional alignment across AI engineering, deployment, and user research, translating user needs into technical priorities. Balanced tradeoffs between LLM accuracy, latency, and cost efficiency while ensuring a seamless end-user experience.
  • AI System Design & Orchestration Co-architected the dual-agent RAG pipeline and coordinated OpenAI + Gemini integration — including model selection, prompt tuning, and failover logic. Developed the reasoning engine and comparison flow from scratch.
  • Defined product success metrics and drove weekly iterative improvements using user-level funnel analysis.

Technical Architecture:

  • Document Parser: Built a custom parser using PyMuPDF with GPT-4 to handle diverse EOC layouts.
  • Vector & Graph Search:
    • Qdrant used for semantic similarity search
    • Neo4j stored structured entities (plans, procedures, conditions, codes).
  • Dual RAG Pipeline: Combined vector and knowledge graph lookups for enhanced context.
  • Reasoning layer:
    • ReAct-style (Reasoning and Action) agents orchestrated by GPT-4 and Gemini.
    • Used for understanding user query, reasoning which tool to use and then taking the action of utilizing tool.
    Utilized Neo4j for structured knowledge representation and relationship mapping.
  • Multi-Document Comparison Engine: Enabled side-by-side plan assessments using LLM-mediated entity mapping and coverage alignment.
  • Deployment: Served via Vercel frontend, backed by Dockerized microservices.

AI Models & Integration:

  • OpenAI o4-mini-high: Primary reasoning engine for complex insurance logic and natural language understanding.
  • Gemini Flash 1.5: Secondary model for document processing and cross-validation of results.
  • Vector Search: Qdrant implementation for semantic similarity and fast document retrieval.
  • Follow-up System: EmailJS integration for automated transcript delivery and user communication.

User Experience Design: Created an intuitive interface that allows users to upload EOC documents, ask natural language questions about coverage, bookmark answers and have TTS (text-to-speech) and STS (speech to text) options.

Results & Performance:

  • Processing Speed: Reduced EOC analysis time from 15 minutes to 90 seconds (90% improvement).
  • Document Coverage: Successfully indexed and processed 10+ diverse Medicare EOC documents.
  • Cost Efficiency: Built and deployed entire demo system for under $10 in cloud costs.
  • Accuracy: Achieved high precision in coverage determination through dual-model validation.

Impact: The system demonstrated significant potential for reducing healthcare administrative burden while improving patient understanding of their insurance coverage. The project showcased how AI can make complex regulatory documents accessible to everyday users.

Distributed System LLM

Problem: Building a scalable, end‑to‑end pipeline to preprocess large text corpora for LLM training and serve interactive conversational AI using cloud‑native distributed computing.

Source Code
×

Distributed System LLM

The Challenge: Building a scalable, end-to-end pipeline to preprocess large text corpora for LLM training while learning and implementing cloud-native distributed computing technologies for real-world AI applications.

My Role: ML Cloud Engineer - As the sole developer, I architected and implemented the distributed system from data processing through model serving .

Data Processing Architecture:

  • Custom MapReduce Jobs: Implemented Hadoop MapReduce workflows for large-scale text tokenization and preprocessing.
  • Embedding Computation: Built distributed embedding generation pipeline with statistical analysis capabilities.
  • Co-occurrence Analysis: Developed MapReduce jobs for computing token co-occurrence matrices and language patterns.
  • Summary Statistics: Generated comprehensive corpus statistics including token counts and frequency distributions.

Cloud Deployment Strategy: I validated all MapReduce workflows on a single-node Hadoop cluster for development, then seamlessly packaged and deployed the entire pipeline to AWS Elastic MapReduce (EMR) for production-scale processing.

Model Inference & Serving:

  • LLM Integration: Wrapped trained language model with ND4J's argMax implementation for next-token prediction.
  • Microservice Architecture: Built RESTful inference service using Akka HTTP with scalable endpoint design.
  • API Design: Exposed clean REST endpoints for text generation with proper error handling and response formatting.
  • Performance Optimization: Implemented efficient tensor operations and memory management for production workloads.

Conversational AI Implementation:

  • Multi-turn Dialogue: Developed client system capable of sustaining coherent conversations across multiple exchanges.
  • Hybrid Architecture: Integrated locally-hosted Ollama model with cloud-based inference for optimal performance.
  • API Orchestration: Built sophisticated request chaining system using Postman scripts and Scala HTTP clients.
  • State Management: Implemented conversation context preservation across service calls.

Documentation & Reproducibility: Created comprehensive documentation including step-by-step cluster setup, EMR console navigation, code execution, and endpoint testing. All processes were captured in narrated screencasts and shared via YouTube for complete reproducibility.

Results & Technical Achievement:

  • Interactive AI Service: Delivered fully functional conversational agent demonstrating seamless big-data and LLM integration.
  • Scalable Architecture: Achieved production-ready distributed system capable of handling large-scale text processing.
  • Cost Efficiency: Optimized AWS EMR usage for minimal cloud costs while maintaining high performance.
  • Standalone Replicability: Created completely self-documented, repeatable pipeline for future extensions.

Technical Innovation: This project successfully bridged the gap between traditional big-data processing and modern AI inference, creating a robust foundation for enterprise-scale conversational AI applications.

Tech Stack: Apache Hadoop (MapReduce), AWS EMR, Scala/Java, ND4J, Akka HTTP, Ollama, Postman, cURL

Research & Presentations

Agentic AI and everything you need to know about them

Pranali Gole, Gargi Sathe | University of Illinois at Chicago, Spring 2025

This technical overview defines agentic AI systems via six core components—perception, planning, memory, reasoning, communication, and action—providing a unified framework for both one‑step and sequential inference models . It surveys agent‑to‑human, agent‑to‑agent, and agent‑to‑tool communication modalities and introduces the CAMEL role‑playing framework for multi‑agent collaboration . Finally, it demonstrates the ReAct function‑calling paradigm and presents the AI Agent Index’s analysis of 67 real‑world systems—covering developer types, safety disclosures, and governance challenges—before compiling key external resources.

Presentation

Cross‑Language Assessment of Mathematical Capability of ChatGPT

Gargi Sathe, Aneesh Shamraj, Aditya Surve, Nahush Patil, Kumkum Saxena. | International Conference on Intelligent Systems Design and Applications, pp. 468–479, 2023.

This paper evaluates ChatGPT’s ability to solve mathematical problems across Hindi, Gujarati and Marathi, investigates whether chain‑of‑thought prompting boosts accuracy in these languages as it does in English, and highlights current limitations in regional Indian contexts

Paper

Ascend.AI Building Confidence Through Technology: A Technical Exploration of Facial Expression, Tone, and Pitch Analysis with Chatbot Guidance

Archit Rathod, Gargi Sathe, Siddh Shah, Kumkum Saxena. | Data Science and Applications (ICDSA 2024), Lecture Notes in Networks and Systems, vol. 1237, pp. 63–77, first online 20 May 2025.

This conference paper presents an AI‑driven interview coaching system that integrates OpenCV and Xception for facial expression analysis, Librosa for vocal tone and pitch feature extraction, a 1D CNN classifier trained on RAVDESS, TESS, SAVEE and CREMA‑D datasets, and a Mixtral 8×7 B–powered chatbot with Qdrant vector retrieval—scraping 30 interview‑question sources to deliver personalized guidance.

Paper
